statement.tex: \text{Show that the semi-vertical angle of the}\\ \text{cone with maximum volume and given slant}\\ \text{height is }\cos^{-1}\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{3}}.
\\ \text{Your friend makes the following claim?} \\ \textbf{Is his claim correct?}

reason.tex: \text{Refer to the figure in Step 1 to see}\\ \begin{align} V &= \dfrac{1}{3}\pi\cdot R^2\cdot H \\ &= \dfrac{1}{3}\pi\cdot \left(L\sin\theta\right)^2\cdot \left(L\cos\theta\right) \\ &= \dfrac{\pi\cdot L^3}{3}\sin^2\theta\cdot\cos\theta \\ \therefore \dfrac{dV}{d\theta} &= \dfrac{\pi L^3}{3} \left[(2\sin\theta\cos\theta)\cos\theta + \sin^2\theta(-\sin\theta)\right] \\ &= \dfrac{\pi L^3}{3}\cdot \sin\theta\cdot \left[2\cdot(1-\sin^2\theta - \sin^2\theta\right] \\ &= \dfrac{\pi L^3}{3}\cdot \sin\theta\cdot (2-3\sin^2\theta) \end{align} \\ \textbf{Extrema points occur when } \\ \begin{align} \dfrac{dV}{d\theta} &= 0 \implies \sin\theta\cdot(2-3\sin^2\theta) = 0 \\ \implies \sin\theta &= 0\text{ or }\sin\theta = \sqrt{\dfrac{2}{3}} \end{align} \\ \sin\theta = 0\implies\implies\text{ no cone.}\therefore \sin\theta = \sqrt{\dfrac{2}{3}}.
